deepseek.prompt:
You are an expert at analyzing organizational dynamics at large financial institutions. PROJECT DESCRIPTION: # Project Summary | | | |---|---| |## 2020 - today|## Deutsche Bank, Frankfurt, Chief Technology Office| |### 2022 - today|### Project lead Contract Compliance/Tech Lead| ||Each piece of software may only be used according to contractually agreed licensing conditions. To ensure these conditions are adhered to DB must have visibility of which contract/s apply to a given software purchase.



- Understand and reverse engineer the process, which was followed up to this point.

- Analyze gaps in process and propose new process.

- Identify and review data sources to be utilized. Flag data quality issues with stakeholders and agree on way forward.

- Formalize new process into automated application, which will generate the required output and update worklists for the team.| |### 2021-2022|### Team Lead Proof of Entitlement/Contractual Provisions Management| ||As team lead for Proof of Entitlement Capturing, leading development of processes and supporting tools to:



- mobilize relevant data from purchasing systems, uploading it to a work list.

- design and implement a backend/frontend solution to enable the PoE team to jointly clear existing purchase order line items, using additional data sources.

- provide automated KPI reporting on involved processes, showing both progress and potential areas of concern.

- ensure available contractual documentation are referred to in Proofs of Entitlement and vice versa.

- provide cleansed PoE records to ServiceNow/SAM Pro for upload and further reporting.

- capture and report on SAM relevant complex contractual provisions.| |### 2020 - 2021|### Financial Planning and Governance - Software License Management| ||One essential task of the Software Expense Line Owner is monitoring spend and reviewing it with the divisional stakeholders. In my role I was tasked with:



- Setting up a network of divisional stakeholders and holding monthly review sessions with all parts of DB.

- Review trends in spending, compare to forecast and plan, initiate appropriate action.

- Prepare monthly updates for review by Board of Director member tasked with expense management and his organization.| |## 2016 - 2020|## Self-Employed| |### 2016 - 2020|### Development of analysis framework for structured text documents| ||Negotiations with large vendors will typically include multiple documents from both sides. Using standard tools to track changes and manage issues becomes quickly cumbersome. This tool tracks the status of each provision in all documents, streamlining the process.



- Generation of ontologies for structured content, such as scientific articles, legal texts, and technical documents.

- Prediction of relevant key phrases, based on statistical models and user input, utilizing machine learning to formalize conclusions.

- Reporting of match/no match condition of paragraphs between document sets.| |## 2010 – 2016|## Novartis, Basel (Global Sourcing)| |### 2012 - 2015|### Global Sourcing IT Change Management and Governance| ||Responsible for the governance of the global IT category of the Novartis group. The category core team consists of 15+ sub-category managers and business partners, dealing with all aspects of IT, such as Software, Mobile Telecoms, Network, Consulting and Outsourcing activities. The role includes managing core aspects of the category team:



- Annual target setting and regular reporting of spend and benefits.

- Implement standard operating procedures for sourcing. Support processes (Supply Chain Finance, SAP CLM, SavePlan, eSourcing.

- Support savings recognition and reporting, reporting to top management.

- Design, implement and maintain reporting backend application, integrating feeds from various data sources (Spend data warehouse, contract database, savings reporting tools, Sharepoint lists) and consolidating these sources into standardized KPI reporting.| |### 2010 – 2012|### Global Lead, Software License Management| ||Served as Group wide designated single point of contact for all software compliance challenges. In this role:



- Managed major software compliance challenges from first contact to final settlement (Interwoven, SAS, SAP).

- Provides guidance to Novartis stakeholders on best practice of software compliance management.

- Interfaced with the Novartis legal team and serves as subject matter expert in contract negotiations and contract template updates.

- Works with internal development team to move Software Compliance Management into proactive mode by analyzing existing applications for possible licensing gaps.| |### 2010 – 2012|### Global Lead, Mobile Telecom Demand Management| ||Lead group wide initiative to manage demand in mobile telecom services to contain spend, improve basket of goods and lower cost. In this role:



- Ran project to evaluate benefits of using a Telecoms Expense management Service (TEMS) in Basel.

- As part of RfI, provided leading TEMS providers with detailed analysis of Connection Data Records (CDRs) to obtain and verify savings forecasts of up to 30% off cost.

- As part of the Novartis negotiation team, managed the TEMS portion of the Vodaphone MSA drafting and finalization.

- Worked with business partners to inform them of available savings levers, such as personal cost transparency, TEMs, VoIP, BYOD and policy adjustments.

- Worked with sourcing leads to report spend and savings.| |### 2010 – 2012|### Software Category Manager| ||Led SAP Enterprise License Management Program. In this role:



- Led group wide program to redesign the group wide annual license measurement process. Designed frontend and backend systems to collect, maintain, analyze and report all information relevant to SAP license management, such as active systems, stakeholders, license inventory, contract databases and compliance reports.

- Used the obtained information to prevent unintended spending for license true ups.

- Collected and aggregated future license demands.

- Negotiated agreement to purchase licenses in bulk from SAP from a strong position, resulting in significant benefits.| |## 2005 - 2010|## Deutsche Bank AG, Frankfurt| |### 2008 – 2010|### Software Licenses and Services Vendor Manager (Global Banking IT)| ||Led Software Licenses and Services team for Deutsche Bank’s Global Banking IT division globally. In this role:



- Led Global Banking team in negotiations of strategic five-year outsourcing deal for software testing services to IBM (12m€+). Reviewed GBITs business requirements and ensured their complete adoption into the contractual documents.

- Helped to establish steering committee to monitor KPIs, manage change requests and disputes. Supervised mandatory outsourcing review, ensuring compliance to national laws and regulations as well as internal policies (Smartsourcing Database).

- Led centralized rate reduction initiative for contractors in Germany and US, resulting in calculated savings of 1.8m€. Negotiated new reduced rates with contractors, identified replacements and ensured termination where required.

- Managed 70+ new contracts (46 Software, 18 time and material, 12 fixed price) amounting to 8m€ and saving 680k€+ in the software space.

- Was part of team introducing and piloting end-to-end contract management processes and tools (HP mercury) in the software space. Developed and enforced rules and guidelines for contract compliance. Designed and built suite of automated reports (dashboard), publicizing vendor management activities by vendor, location, and program.| |### 2005 – 2008|### Software Category Manager (Global Procurement)| ||Led software category management in EMEA and co-led the category globally. In this role:



- Managed 70+ new contracts (46 Software, 18 time and material, 12 fixed price) amounting to 8m€ and saving 680k€+ in the software space.

- Initiated and completed transactions with strategic software vendors that concluded in significant benefits (Microsoft, HP, WebMethods, Adobe).

- Actively worked with senior technology architects from the CIO organizations to identify their most important strategic vendors and then worked with vendors to implement terms and conditions that support DB’s business objectives.

- Supported negotiation of new Enterprise Agreement with strategic vendors (Microsoft, Adobe, Hummingbird) and led contractual implementation including execution of annual “True-Ups”.

- Compiled existing DB contract templates into a dynamic contract master (189+ clauses), used to assess compliance risks of running contracts (server and desktop virtualization, white labeling, offshoring and other).

- Initiated and managed vendor portal onboarding project, which looks to strategic vendors to upload contracts, catalogues, application signatures and license reports on a regular basis (IBM, Microsoft, Tibco).| |### 2005 – 2007|### Global Software Compliance Manager (Global Procurement)| ||Led Deutsche Bank’s Software License Management organization, In this role:



- Build, and trained global team of 200+ License managers, Senior License Managers and Product Managers. Wrote and maintained software policy and process documentation.

- Worked with the SLM team, senior management, and vendors to resolve licensing issues (replacement, removal, centralized purchasing) with vendors such as Microsoft, Adobe, Borland, Bea, The Mathworks and Quest.

- Generated demand-based software catalogues. Used online and offline auctions to establish best price per product/region and publish these catalogues for online procurement.

- Trained and used SLM team to handle centralized software distribution and procurement within DB (12.000 request per month), generating ca. 2M€ systematic savings p.a.| |## 2002 – 2005|## Independent producer for public television, Mainz| ||Produced video material for Germanys largest television station, the ZDF ( Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen). Was active in scripting, filming, producing, editing and CGI.



- “Der brennende Dornbusch – Glanz und Elend der Juden in Europa” (3x45min, historical documentation).

- “Das Wunder in der Wüste – Moses und der Aufbruch in die Freiheit” (45min, reenactment and documentary).

- “37 Grad - Wie schön, dass Du geboren bist” (30min, documentary).

- “37 Grad – Einmal drüber und schon sauber” (30min, documentary).| |## 1996 - 2001|## Freelance contractor, Basel, Darmstadt, Frankfurt, Mainz| |### 2001-2002|### Deutsche Bank, Vendor Manager, Frankfurt| ||Was part of project eBranch, responsible for setting up vendor management team. In this role:



- Modelled the process framework for vendor management according to CMM (Capability Maturity Management).

- Researched and evaluated (functionality mapping) key technologies.

- Set up and ran Requests for proposal.

- Compiled and evaluated project scenarios by risk, cost, usability and TCO.

- Wrote Contract specification and reviewed them with internal and external partners.

- Took part in contract negotiations, managed changes in the vendor relationship and was responsible for the quality assurance of deliverables.| |### 1998-1999|### Commerzbank, Application Architect, Frankfurt| ||Was project manager of project ZUM (Zentrales User-Management) in charge of designing and implementating centralized user and IT ressource requirements management (hardware, software) for the whole of Deutsche Post. In this role:



- Designed of first prototypes as proof of concept.

- Evaluated feasible software solutions.

- Managed selection process and onboarding of chosen supplier.

- Populated application with first set of data by integrating available data sources from LDAP and legacy systems.

- Coordinated application development, rollout and coaching of the new team.| |### 1998|### F. Hoffmann – La Roche, Rollout Manager, Basel| ||Worked as member of the development team for „Common Office Environment“ (COE/2.1) – the standardized, Global Desktop environment of Client/Server-based systems.



- Evaluate and feed back user test results into procedures for global rollout and localization of installed systems.

- Documented core systems management processes, such as software distribution, license management and daily administrative tasks.| |### 1997-1998|### Dresdner Bank, Information Architect, Frankfurt| ||Part of global effort to design and implement a new information desktop for Dresdner Private Banking:



- Collected information requirements through series of business managers worldwide.

- Distilled information requirements into an information desktop, which was presented to the global business manager community.

- Planned, staffed, and budgeted implementation of information desktop.| |### 1996-1997|### Deutsche Bahn, Helpdesk and Rollout Manager, Frankfurt| ||- Planned, staffed, and budgeted implementation of information desktop.


- Worked as part of project team “Bürokommunikation unternehmensweit (BKU)” to establish helpdesk support for first Client/Server environment within Deutsche Bahn

- Defined procedures for identification and quick classification of recurring errors and their resolution.

- Helped to outsource helpdesk to external vendor.

- Planned rollout of active components of Deutsche Bahns network.| Reason step-by-step and provide: 1. **STAKEHOLDER LEVELS**: What levels of stakeholders would this person interact with? - C-level executives (CIO, CFO, CTO, etc.) - Directors/VPs (which functions?) - Managers (which departments?) 2. **FUNCTIONS INVOLVED**: What organizational functions would be engaged? - Legal? Procurement? IT? Finance? Compliance? Operations? - Be specific about WHY each function is involved 3. **ORGANIZATIONAL SKILLS REQUIRED**: What organizational navigation skills does this require? - Stakeholder management - Cross-functional collaboration - Influence without authority - etc. Think through the organizational complexity carefully. Consider this is a LARGE BANK with complex governance.

In this role:

Hoffmann – La Roche, Rollout Manager, Basel| ||Worked as member of the development team for „Common Office Environment“ (COE/2.1) – the standardized, Global Desktop environment of Client/Server-based systems.



- Evaluate and feed back user test results into procedures for global rollout and localization of installed systems.

- Documented core systems management processes, such as software distribution, license management and daily administrative tasks.| |### 1997-1998|### Dresdner Bank, Information Architect, Frankfurt| ||Part of global effort to design and implement a new information desktop for Dresdner Private Banking:



- Collected information requirements through series of business managers worldwide.

- Distilled information requirements into an information desktop, which was presented to the global business manager community.

- Planned, staffed, and budgeted implementation of information desktop.| |### 1996-1997|### Deutsche Bahn, Helpdesk and Rollout Manager, Frankfurt| ||- Planned, staffed, and budgeted implementation of information desktop.


- Worked as part of project team “Bürokommunikation unternehmensweit (BKU)” to establish helpdesk support for first Client/Server environment within Deutsche Bahn

- Defined procedures for identification and quick classification of recurring errors and their resolution.

- Helped to outsource helpdesk to external vendor.

- Planned rollout of active components of Deutsche Bahns network.| Analyze and list: 1. **SOFTWARE & TOOLS**: What specific software/tools were MOST LIKELY used? - Focus on REALISTIC, COMMON tools for this domain - Avoid over-engineering (no ML unless explicitly suggested) - Consider: office tools, databases, automation platforms, etc. 2. **TECHNICAL SKILLS**: What technical competencies are required? - Programming languages (if any) - Database/query skills - System integration - Data analysis - Process automation 3. **STANDARDS & METHODOLOGIES**: What industry standards, regulations, or methodologies apply? - ISO standards? - Compliance frameworks (GDPR, SOX, etc.) - Project management methodologies? - Software licensing standards? Be PRACTICAL and SPECIFIC. Avoid generic answers.
qwen.response:
### 1. SOFTWARE & TOOLS

#### Most Likely Used:

- **Office Tools**:
  - Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
  - Google Workspace or similar tools for collaboration

- **Data Management & Analysis**:
  - SQL Databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL)
  - Data Query and Reporting Tools (e.g., Microsoft Power BI, Tableau)

- **Process Automation**:
  - RPA Tools like UiPath or Blue Prism
  - Low-code Platforms such as Zoho Creator, Microsoft Power Automate

- **Backend/Development Tools**:
  - Python, Java, or C# for automating processes and integrations
  - Scripting Languages (e.g., Bash, PowerShell)

- **Data Quality & Analysis**:
  - Data Cleaning Tools (e.g., Talend)
  - ETL Tools (e.g., Informatica, Talend)
  
- **Project Management**:
  - Jira for issue tracking and project management
  - Confluence for documentation

### 2. TECHNICAL SKILLS

#### Required Technical Competencies:

- **Programming Languages**:
  - Python: For data analysis and automation tasks.
  - Java or C#: For backend development and integration.

- **Database & Query Skills**:
  - SQL (Advanced): To manage and query databases.
  
- **System Integration**:
  - API Development and Management
  - Integration with existing systems like ServiceNow, SAP CLM, etc.

- **Data Analysis**:
  - Statistical Modeling: For predictive analysis in PoE capturing.
  - Data Cleaning & Transformation Techniques
  
- **Process Automation**:
  - RPA Tools (UiPath, Blue Prism)
  - Low-code Platforms (Zoho Creator)

### 3. STANDARDS & METHODOLOGIES

#### Industry Standards and Regulations:

- **Compliance Frameworks**:
  - GDPR: For handling sensitive data.
  - SOX: For financial compliance in the US.

- **Project Management Methodologies**:
  - Agile/Scrum Methodology: For iterative development processes.
  
- **Software Licensing Standards**:
  - Software Assurance and Compliance Best Practices
  - Common Industry Standards like Microsoft’s SPLA (Software License Agreement)
  
- **Data Quality & Integrity**:
  - ISO 9001:2015 for quality management systems.

This analysis provides a practical and specific overview of the technical tools, skills, and standards likely used in the described projects.

olmo.prompt:

- Led centralized rate reduction initiative for contractors in Germany and US, resulting in calculated savings of 1.8m€. Negotiated new reduced rates with contractors, identified replacements and ensured termination where required.

- Managed 70+ new contracts (46 Software, 18 time and material, 12 fixed price) amounting to 8m€ and saving 680k€+ in the software space.

- Was part of team introducing and piloting end-to-end contract management processes and tools (HP mercury) in the software space. Developed and enforced rules and guidelines for contract compliance. Designed and built suite of automated reports (dashboard), publicizing vendor management activities by vendor, location, and program.| |### 2005 – 2008|### Software Category Manager (Global Procurement)| ||Led software category management in EMEA and co-led the category globally. Hoffmann – La Roche, Rollout Manager, Basel| ||Worked as member of the development team for „Common Office Environment“ (COE/2.1) – the standardized, Global Desktop environment of Client/Server-based systems.

- Collected information requirements through series of business managers worldwide.

- Worked as part of project team “Bürokommunikation unternehmensweit (BKU)” to establish helpdesk support for first Client/Server environment within Deutsche Bahn

- Defined procedures for identification and quick classification of recurring errors and their resolution.

- Planned rollout of active components of Deutsche Bahns network.| List the SOFT SKILLS required for this role. Focus on: **COMMUNICATION SKILLS:** - Written/verbal communication - Presentation skills - Technical translation (explaining tech to non-tech) **INTERPERSONAL SKILLS:** - Stakeholder management - Negotiation - Diplomacy - Conflict resolution **LEADERSHIP & INFLUENCE:** - Team leadership - Influence without authority - Change management **ANALYTICAL & PROBLEM-SOLVING:** - Critical thinking - Problem decomposition - Root cause analysis **PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES:** - Attention to detail - Adaptability - Persistence - Political savvy Be specific about WHY each skill is needed based on the project description.
olmo.response:
**COMMUNICATION SKILLS:**

* **Written/verbal communication:** The role involves writing formal documentation, contract specifications, and KPI reporting. It also requires clear verbal communication to convey complex technical information to stakeholders without a technical background. Clear and precise language is essential to avoid misunderstandings in contract negotiations and process implementation.

* **Presentation skills:** The Project Lead Contract Compliance/Tech Lead will need to present the proposed process changes and technological solutions to stakeholders, including potentially presenting proposals to senior management or Board members. Effective presentation skills are necessary to persuasively communicate ideas and gain support for project initiatives.

* **Technical translation:** Given that the role involves explaining complex technical processes and issues to stakeholders with varying levels of technical understanding, the ability to translate technical concepts into layman's terms is crucial. This ensures everyone can comprehend the information and contributes to better decision-making.

**INTERPERSONAL SKILLS:**

* **Stakeholder management:** The project lead must manage interactions with diverse stakeholders, including team members, divisional stakeholders, vendors, and external partners. Stakeholder management involves keeping them informed, engaged, and aligned with project goals.

* **Negotiation:** This role requires negotiation skills to establish new processes and agreements that adhere to license conditions. Effective negotiation ensures contracts are structured in a way that benefits both parties while strictly abiding by licensing constraints.

* **Diplomacy:** Diplomatic skills are needed to handle potential conflicts or disagreements, ensuring a peaceful resolution that maintains strong working relationships. This is particularly important when negotiating changes or addressing compliance issues.

* **Conflict resolution:** Skilled at resolving disputes and finding constructive solutions when team members or stakeholders have differing viewpoints on process improvements or technical issues.

**LEADERSHIP & INFLUENCE:**

* **Team leadership:** As a project lead, managing a team is central to ensuring the successful completion of tasks. Leading by example and providing clear direction help to motivate and guide team members.

* **Influence without authority:** The position demands the ability to persuade and influence decisions without direct managerial authority. This includes convincing stakeholders and superiors of the benefits and necessity of proposed changes.

* **Change management:** The project often involves instituting significant process changes, requiring the ability to manage the transition smoothly and ensure the adoption of new practices.

**ANALYTICAL & PROBLEM-SOLVING:**

* **Critical thinking:** Making well-informed decisions requires the ability to analyze situations critically, evaluate the root causes of problems, and consider multiple perspectives before arriving at a solution.

* **Problem decomposition:** Breaking down complex issues into manageable components allows for systematic analysis and tackling of each part individually, ensuring no aspect is overlooked.

* **Root cause analysis:** Understanding why something went wrong is key to preventing similar issues in the future. Root cause analysis helps uncover the fundamental reason behind problems and leads to long-lasting solutions.

**PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES:**

* **Attention to detail:** Precision is critical when reviewing contracts, analyzing data, and ensuring compliance with licensing conditions. Small errors could lead to significant legal or financial issues.

* **Adaptability:** The fast-paced and frequently changing environment of software project management necessitates the ability to pivot strategies and adapt to new circumstances swiftly.

* **Persistence:** This role requires tenacity, especially in negotiating complex agreements or convincing stakeholders to adopt new practices. Persistence through challenges ensures that projects are completed successfully.

* **Political savvy:** Understanding organizational politics is essential for navigating the internal landscapes of large organizations, securing buy-in from key players, and managing internal relationships effectively.
